# Debug Report: Scrolling Not Working on Website
Generated: 2026-01-28

## Symptom
Scrolling is not working on the website - page appears to be stuck/locked.

## Hypotheses Tested

1. **CSS overflow blocking scroll** - PARTIALLY CONFIRMED - `overflow-hidden` on HeroSection
2. **No scrollable content exists** - CONFIRMED - Only HeroSection is rendered; other sections are commented out
3. **Fixed positioning blocking scroll** - RULED OUT - AnimatedBackground uses `pointer-events-none`
4. **JavaScript event interference** - RULED OUT - No scroll event blocking found

## Investigation Trail

| Step | Action | Finding |
|------|--------|---------|
| 1 | Read globals.css | Only `overflow-x: hidden` on html/body (horizontal scroll prevention) |
| 2 | Read page.tsx | Only HeroSection rendered; other sections commented out (lines 33-37) |
| 3 | Read HeroSection.tsx | Contains `overflow-hidden` class on the section element |
| 4 | Read AnimatedBackground.tsx | Uses `fixed inset-0 pointer-events-none` - correctly configured |
| 5 | Read Navigation.tsx | Only appears after 500px scroll; uses standard scroll listener |

## Evidence

### Finding 1: HeroSection has `overflow-hidden`
- **Location:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/components/HeroSection.tsx:83`
- **Code:**
```tsx
<section ref={heroRef} className="relative min-h-screen flex flex-col items-center justify-center px-4 overflow-hidden">
```
- **Observation:** The `overflow-hidden` class prevents any content overflow and can interfere with scroll behavior when combined with min-h-screen.
- **Relevance:** This prevents scrollable content within this section.

### Finding 2: No Content Below Hero Section
- **Location:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/app/page.tsx:32-37`
- **Code:**
```tsx
{/* Future sections will go here */}
{/* <WhatIsSubcultSection /> */}
{/* <SubcultConceptSection /> */}
{/* <HowItWorksSection /> */}
{/* <ExploreScenesSection /> */}
{/* <Footer /> */}
```
- **Observation:** All additional sections are commented out. The page only contains:
  1. AnimatedBackground (fixed, doesn't add height)
  2. Navigation (fixed, appears on scroll > 500px)
  3. HeroSection (min-h-screen - exactly viewport height)
- **Relevance:** With only a single viewport-height section, there is literally nothing to scroll to.

### Finding 3: HeroSection Shows "Scroll to explore" Indicator
- **Location:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/components/HeroSection.tsx:149-152`
- **Code:**
```tsx
<div className="absolute bottom-8 ...">
  <div className="w-6 h-10 border-2 border-gray-700 rounded-full ...">
    <div className="w-1.5 h-1.5 bg-white rounded-full animate-bounce" />
  </div>
  <span className="text-gray-600 text-xs">Scroll to explore</span>
</div>
```
- **Observation:** The UI tells users to scroll, but there is no content to scroll to.
- **Relevance:** UX inconsistency - scroll indicator exists but scrolling does nothing.

## Root Cause

**PRIMARY CAUSE:** No scrollable content exists. The page only renders a single section (`HeroSection`) that is exactly viewport height (`min-h-screen`). All other sections are commented out.

**SECONDARY ISSUE:** The `overflow-hidden` class on HeroSection would prevent internal scrolling even if content exceeded viewport.

**Confidence:** High

**Alternative hypotheses:** None - the evidence is conclusive.

## Recommended Fix

### Option A: Add Placeholder Content (Quick Test)
Add temporary content to verify scrolling works when content exists.

**File:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/app/page.tsx`
**Change:** After line 30 (after `<HeroSection />`), add:

  <h2 className="text-4xl text-white">Section 2 - Scroll works!</h2>

Uncomment and implement the planned sections:
- WhatIsSubcultSection
- SubcultConceptSection  
- HowItWorksSection
- ExploreScenesSection
- Footer

### Option C: Remove Scroll Indicator (If Single-Page Intended)
If the page is intentionally single-viewport, remove the misleading scroll indicator.

**File:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/components/HeroSection.tsx`
**Change:** Remove lines 147-153 (the scroll indicator div)

### Additional Fix: Remove `overflow-hidden` from HeroSection
**File:** `/Users/chrisrair/subcult/subcult-website/components/HeroSection.tsx:83`
**Change:** Remove `overflow-hidden` from the section className:

```tsx
// Before
<section ref={heroRef} className="relative min-h-screen flex flex-col items-center justify-center px-4 overflow-hidden">

// After  
<section ref={heroRef} className="relative min-h-screen flex flex-col items-center justify-center px-4">
```

## Prevention

1. When adding scroll indicators, ensure scrollable content exists
2. Use `overflow-hidden` sparingly - only when genuinely needed to clip content
3. Keep section components implemented (not commented out) even as placeholders during development
